definition: to stir oneself up/to raise one's spirits/to inspire
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself

sentences.english: W2: The exciting atmosphere of change and development.
sentences.chinese: 那令人振奮的鉅變和發展氛圍。

sentences.english: Traveling is unarguably one of the most gratifying experiences a person can have in their lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊無疑是人一生中的一個最振奮人心的經歷之一。

sentences.english: It’ll flush your system and reduce headaches and constipation.
sentences.chinese: 這樣會振奮你的身體系統並減少頭痛和便祕。

sentences.english: The team was flushed with its first victory.
sentences.chinese: 這個隊因初次勝利而感振奮。

sentences.english: Mum suggests that I should cheer up when meeting with setbacks.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽建議我在遇到挫折時應振奮起來。
我覺得年輕人令人振奮。

sentences.english: His friends' words inspired him to try again.
sentences.chinese: 他朋友的話使他振奮起來再試一次。

sentences.english: The Monkey King has the children of China for many years.
sentences.chinese: 多年來美猴王已使中國的兒童振奮不已。

sentences.english: Then he rouses from his sleep and begins a chase.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他振奮，開始從他的睡眠追逐。

sentences.english: It was a very hot day. The water was very refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 天氣很熱，河水使人振奮。

sentences.english: As the week rolls on, you'll find the energy shifts into a more social & uplifting energy...
sentences.chinese: 這星期，你的星運適合社交活動方面，越發振奮。

sentences.english: Let's try to buck the losers up.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們努力使失敗者精神振奮。

sentences.english: It is exciting to be part of this.
sentences.chinese: 能成爲其中的一員是多麼的令人振奮。

sentences.english: I need to prepare a gourmet menu that's going to be mind-blowing .
sentences.chinese: 我要準備一份能令人振奮的美食家菜譜。

definition: happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
